column8: From the bases of the personal pronouns, the oldest possessive pronouns seem to have been mos, mine, ṇsmós, ours, twos, thine, usmós, yours, swos, own.

The common Late Indo-European possessives were formed from the same bases with suffixes -(i)jo- in the singular, -(t)ero- in the plural; as, méwijos, menjos, my,ṇserós, our, téwijos, thy, userós, your, séwijos.
Possessives are declined like adjectives of the first type, in -os, -ā, -om.
